brief_summary.textblock: This clinical study is a multicenter, prospective non-randomized observational study without concurrent or matched controls in which 150 patients receiving an SJM® Rigid Saddle Ring will be included. The primary objective of the study is to demonstrate the effectiveness of the SJM® Rigid Saddle Ring when used in mitral valve repair procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in ERO (Effective Regurgitant Orifice) in cm2 calculated with PISA method at 6 months and at patient discharge compared to baseline (pre-operative).

arm_group.description: The SJM® Rigid Saddle Ring is an annuloplasty ring comprised of a titanium core surrounded by a double-velour, polyester fabric sewing cuff.

intervention.intervention_name: mitral valve repair (SJM® Rigid Saddle Ring)
intervention.description: mitral valve repair due to mitral degenerative or functional disease
